'''''Lycoperdon curtisii''''' is a type of [[puffball]] mushroom in the genus ''[[Lycoperdon]]''. It was first [[species description|described]] scientifically in 1859 by [[Miles Joseph Berkeley]]. ''Vascellum curtisii'', published by [[Hanns Kreisel]] in 1963, is a [[synonym (taxonomy)|synonym]].<ref name="urlMycoBank: Vascellum curtisii"/> Its fruit bodies (puffballs) have been recorded growing in [[fairy ring]]s.<ref name=Terashima2004>{{cite journal |vauthors=Terashima Y, Fukiharu T, Fujiie A |year=2004 |title=Morphology and comparative ecology of the fairy ring fungi, ''Vascellum curtisii'' and ''Bovista dermoxantha'', on turf of bentgrass, bluegrass, and Zoysiagrass |journal=Mycoscience |volume=45 |issue=4 |pages=251–60 |doi=10.1007/s10267-004-0183-y}}</ref>
